Voter fraud has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's top election official is warning residents about a possible scam to obtain sensitive information from potential voters after similar concerns in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases send the voter an absentee ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot over the phone.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a substantial part of the general ledger. During the annual audit, auditors will verify if their assertions regarding the accounts receivable balance can be proven. These assertions are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask their clients to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proven through confirmation can help you understand why your auditor requests multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations primarily serve to prove the existence assertion.

It happens: you press the snooze button once, twice, and then three times, so that when you've finally showered, dressed, and are ready to face the day, you're already running behind schedule. Many times, that makes you skip breakfast altogether. It turns out that your habit of having breakfast is a time-saving measure that shouldn't be skipped. First, eating a nutritious, high-protein, and balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to give your brain a boost, improving concentration and performance. Additionally, breakfast is associated with better weight control, as it provides energy to your body and can reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly on Friday to support Ireland's first abortion bill, legalizing the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem a woman's life to be at risk due to her pregnancy, as the predominantly Catholic country took its first legislative step away from a total ban. Exhausted lawmakers applauded the 127-31 Friday vote, while outside the parliament gates, pro-choice activists celebrated as they watched the result on their smartphones. It brought an end to an exhausting debate that kept lawmakers in discussion from Wednesday morning until 5 am on Thursday and, after a break to sleep, until midnight on Friday.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to collapse under the intense heat of Volgograd when they face Nigeria in only their second World Cup match on Friday, after impressively drawing with two-time champions Argentina over the weekend. World Cup debutants Iceland are dreaming of the knockout phase and are writing a new chapter in one of the most notable stories in international football in recent years. On their path is not only Nigeria, desperate for a win after losing their opening match 2-0 to Croatia, but also the challenge of the scorching temperatures in the southern Russian city.

After the Coquitlam RCMP and Canadian postal inspectors worked together to investigate the thefts, investigators identified a prime suspect, made arrests, and used search warrants to acquire a large amount of evidence, according to a November 11 press release from the Coquitlam RCMP. However, one can only be excited about his defeat. The fact that it happened only demonstrates how fundamentally rotten the GOP landscape had become in general. Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules that prohibit abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea might "not be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why the president wasn't kicked off the service. In a six-part tweet from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes into account "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining whether a user has violated its rules. These considerations have long been used internally when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

After basically keeping pace during the first two months of the year, real estate sales in Summit County experienced a slump in March, leading to a notable downturn in the county's first-quarter figures, according to Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide range of statistics associated with the local real estate market, and Summit saw a 12 percent decrease in both the number of real estate transactions and their combined value for the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company's latest market report.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror lurks among the residents of Pata Island in Sulu, and it does not come from extremists, but from politicians. The residents sought help from the government to prevent another attack on their island community, which, according to one of them, was triggered by the residents' refusal to support the incumbent mayor, Anton Burahan. "We are powerless," said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangon, one of the villages on Pata Island. Jubail recalled an attack on the island on January 2, allegedly by Burahan's followers, who were armed with an M203 grenade launcher, and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

German business confidence plummeted in October to its lowest level in more than two and a half years, the sixth consecutive decline that dispels any remaining doubt that Europe's largest economy has now been caught up in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of around 7,000 companies, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro hit a one-week low against the dollar and European stocks turned negative after the Ifo announcement.

LOS ANGELES – A proposal to grant subpoena power to the oversight commission that monitors the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will go to a vote in March 2020, after not being adopted by the Board of Supervisors today. Supporters of the "Los Angeles County Jail Reform Initiative" gathered nearly a quarter of a million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to study reducing the county's jail population and redirecting dollars from jail construction to alternatives to incarceration. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said that more of the county's more than 10 million residents should be allowed to participate in the vote.

OTTAWA, March 20 (Reuters) - In a new blow to the beleaguered government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a lawmaker left his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since February 7 over allegations that high-ranking officials working for him pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc would avoid a corruption trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of being re-elected in a vote scheduled for October this year.

The Iranian Foreign Minister, Javad Zarif, met with Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the prime minister's house, where both sides emphasized the need to promote bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. Without a doubt, the addiction drama "Beautiful Boy" – and not the horror movie "Halloween" – is the scariest movie opening in the multiplex this weekend. Starring Steve Carell ("Foxcatcher") and Timothée Chalamet ("Call Me by Your Name"), the film is a chilling and disturbing look at a young man's descent into methamphetamine addiction (and heroin, pills, marijuana, etc.) and a devoted father's efforts to save him. The inclined press is a strength training exercise to develop the chest and front parts of the shoulders. Brazil is currently implementing the Brazil without Misery program — a continuation of the successful Zero Hunger — which aims to do just that, says Marques Porto. Launched in 2003 by former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, Zero Hunger is credited with lifting 30 or 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the main actions of the program was to provide poor children with free school meals, which were purchased by the state from family farms. In this way, support was provided to local small farmers while offering quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow, one only has to look at the considerable increase in commissioned facilities to find evidence of this. Consumers are no longer impressed with data centers spanning several thousand square meters, containing 1000 or more racks, as these have become common. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, over the past two years, Russia's data center market is ahead of India, China, and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, according to recent construction data from the same period, Russia ranks second only to Brazil among BRICS nations in terms of total area.

The pharmaceutical giant Pfizer exceeded Wall Street estimates for the third quarter, but a comment made by CEO Ian Read during the earnings call suggests weakness on the horizon. Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer (NYSE: PFE) impressed Wall Street once again by reporting better-than-expected third-quarter earnings before the market opened on Wednesday. For the quarter, Pfizer generated $12.09 billion in revenue, a 2% year-over-year decline, while its reported net income decreased 20% to $2.13 billion from $2.67 billion. GENEVA – The head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the conflict in Gaza, Judge Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory, as he presented the Mission's report* to the Human Rights Council. Following its three-month investigation, the four-person Mission concluded that serious violations of international human rights and humanitarian law were committed by Israel in the context of its military operations in Gaza from 27 December 2008 to 18 January 2009, and that Israel committed actions that amount to war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.

The junior minister of North Korea for reeducation has as his main task to refute everything that French intellectuals have said. One year he did a special on Jean-Paul Sartre and began with Sartre's statement that "Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do". As it was a sleepy Friday afternoon, the junior minister simply made a quick phone call and changed the name of his local football team to Deportivo 4:25 Club. John Tory has his first real competition in the mayoral race. Jennifer Keesmaat, the city's former chief planner, registered on Friday before the 2 p.m. deadline to run for mayor. Keesmaat said she made the decision so recently that she didn't have time to tell her parents she was running. "It was a very last-minute decision, but one that comes deeply from my heart and passion for this city," she said, when asked if she was joining the mayoral race because of Premier Doug Ford's announcement that he would reduce the size of council to 25 members.

Oden Technologies, an emerging startup that seeks to make factories smarter through big data and its Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) platform, has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Ventures, Inbox Capital, and a number of other seed investors. Founded in London in 2014, Oden Technologies provides the hardware and software that enables manufacturers to access analytics to track failures and establish patterns that can affect performance. Ultimately, it's about improving efficiency and reducing production waste.
